stim_file.Description: File of image presented. For button pressing events no info is provided (designated by [])

trial_type.Description: Comprenhesive information of stimulus and responses corresponding to each event

Levels.famous_second_early: Immediate repeated  presentation of famous face
Levels.famous_second_late: Delayed repeated  presentation of famous face
Levels.scrambled_second_early: Immediate repeated  presentation of scrambled face
Levels.scrambled_second_late: Delayed repeated  presentation of scrambled face
Levels.unfamiliar_second_early: Immediate repeated  presentation of unfamiliar face
Levels.unfamiliar_second_late: Delayed repeated  presentation of unfamiliar face
Levels.right_nonsym: Right button press to indicated less symmetric face
Levels.left_sym: Left button press to indicated more symmetric face
Levels.left_nonsym: Left button press to indicated less symmetric face
Levels.right_sym: Right button press to indicated more symmetric face
Levels.boundary: The boundary mark of each run as the run data was merged

event_type.Description: Represent the two more general types events in the experiment

Levels.button_press: Button pressing indicating level of symmetry of face presented

Levels.6: Immediate repeated  presentation of famous face
Levels.7: Delayed repeated  presentation of famous face
Levels.14: Immediate repeated  presentation of unfamiliar face
Levels.15: Delayed repeated  presentation of unfamiliar face
Levels.18: Immediate repeated  presentation of scrambled face
Levels.19: Delayed repeated  presentation of scrambled face

event_order.Description: Each image is presented twice. This index represent the order of presentation of each image

Levels.0: Not an image. This may be a button press or a boundary

trial_dist.Description: Distance in trial units since the previous presentation of the same image

time_dist.Description: Time since the previous presentation of the same image
